intro: Primula szechuanica, commonly known as the Sichuan primrose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky slopes. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
